ygData.subject: Re: Jaxan's Jig
ygData.msgSnippet: I can assure you JM is the real deal, well at least there is a JM on the dev team.  I have a friend who knows him and several other developers from early early
ygData.messageBody:
I can assure you JM is the real deal, well at least there is a JM on the dev
team. I have a friend who knows him and several other developers from early
early beta... like 1 i think.
Penaden
The Lost Order of Akalabeth
www.lostorder.com

Roop Dirump wrote:

> From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
>
> [data left out]
>
> Well J.M. Capozzi laid it to rest a while back. Jig actually has no effect
> on mana.
>
> Course, if you can indeed disprove him then I'd be thinking J.M. Capozzi
> wasn't really with Verant afterall. I mean I can't confirm whether or not
> J.M. is legit. Is this just someone who just joined the list, and knew a
> heck of a lot about the game and faked it?
>
> Actually, I doubt that J.M. is a "fake" but wish you consider it, for
> arguments sake. I have no idea who J.M. is, and have no resource to confirm
> it for that matter. Must say, if J.M. were a fake, he or she would be a
> very good fake. But who are we, as the grunts, to know who makes the game
> anyway?
>
> Credits tell us little, as does Verant's webpage.
>
> I like how Lionhead did it: they hired an actual journalist with games
> experience to be part of their team. You check their webpage, and you have
> a writer from the inside giving you personal insights. Get an idea how they
> actually tick, and it's very interesting. You also know who everybody is!
>
> I have no idea who makes EverQuest.
>
> Roop
>
> >From: "Douglass Family" <frd@...>
> >
> >I know this thread has been around, Ive been here for quite a while.......
> >And Ive usually been the bard, but Ive never had the opportunity to time
> it,
> >all of my travelling companions swear by it though. I had assumed by
> >listening to this list that they were either humoring me or it was in their
> >heads. It just happened that I had the opportunity myself and I was
> >suprised by the outcome. After thinking about it, if it is truely a
> refresh
> >rate my test may not have been very accurate, I tested bubbles 2-4 because
> >they were the easiest to track.
>
